issue.title: [Website] Fix search indexing warning reported by Google
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-7384](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7384). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I received the following e-mail from Google regarding arrow.apache.org (since I'm an admin on the Analytics account)

```Java

Top Warnings

Warnings are suggestions for improvement. Some warnings can affect your appearance on Search; some might be reclassified as errors in the future. The following warnings were found on your site:

Indexed, though blocked by robots.txt

We recommend that you fix these issues when possible to enable the best experience and coverage in Google Search.
```

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7384?focusedCommentId=17117147) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Still valid? Is this something we can do anything about, or is this INFRA?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7384?focusedCommentId=17117256) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I would guess it's still a problem. I think it's something to do with our Jekyll website configuration

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7384?focusedCommentId=17117861) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Ok, I just didn't see a robots.txt file in the arrow-site repo, so I figured it might be coming from top level apache.org.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7384?focusedCommentId=17202913) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I just got another warning about this, so Google seems to still think this is a problem

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7384?focusedCommentId=17202920) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
We don't have a `robots.txt` currently and it seems that the 404 page confuses Googlebot sometimes.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7384?focusedCommentId=17202921) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Google e-mailed me to inform that the issue has been fixed after the linked PR was merged
